text.p: Roche Holding AG said the positive growth seen in 1996 had continued into the first months of the current year and the group expected to report another good result for 1997.

"Barring extraordinary events, we expect to post another good year result for 1997 despite the high levels of investment referred to above for the introduction of new products," Roche said in an advance copy of its 1996 annual report.
The report also said that the Swiss pharmaceutical group anticipated a substantial overall rise in marketing costs due to the launch of new products this year.
Roche last month reported that its 1996 group net profit rose 16 percent to 3.90 billion Swiss francs from 3.37 billion in 1995. Group sales rose 10.7 percent to 15.966 billion.
